flawed_nl_solution:
The bus to Ryan's work takes 10 minutes longer than his bike ride, so it takes 10 + 30 = <<10+30=30>>30 minutes.
Ryan takes the bus 3 times a week, so the bus rides take 30 * 3 = <<30*3=90>>90 minutes a week.
His friend cuts 2/3 off his biking time, which is 2/3*30 = <<2/3*30=20>>20 minutes a week.
This means his friend takes 30-20 = <<30-20=10>>10 minutes to drive him.
Therefore, Ryan spends 90 + 10 + 30 = <<90+10+30=130>>130 minutes every week commuting to work.
#### 130

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 30. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
